title: Could I have some gameplay advice please?

embed.description: This is "Fizz Sol vid-HD 720p" by Lord Sesshomaru on Vimeo, the home for high quality videos and the people who love them.

body:
Fizz is a champion that i consistently can not do well against, and its very frustrating. 
Im just not sure what I should be doing against him, so I'm here for help :P

_________

Obviously Sol/Fizz is a terrible matchup, but nevertheless it shouldn't be impossible, therefore there must be a way that I'm just not seeing.

Fizz is 1 kill ahead, but we are dead even on farm, so fizz has the level advantage _(only just though)_. The video is shown in slow motion for easy analysis.

In the video, I am keeping as much distance as I can from him (due to his tendency of suddenly jumping on you). I am already missing farm _(and have been for a while)_, and when I do go for what little farm I can get from the "safe distance", I am using the fully extended stars (they have 100 more range than my Autos) so i am at absolute maximum range here, any safer and I am missing farm completely. 

But even at maximum range, Fizz can hit his ult with ease, use his E to close the gap _(and it still hits me!)_, and then... well he's inside my stars with half his combo left, and theres nothing i can do, even under my turret.

I just want to farm, at maximum range, while using mana to do so.
But the way i currently play, i cant even do that. 

__________

So what should I be doing?
How can I farm, while not being at this much risk of being 100-0 in allied territory? 

I know Fizz had the level advantage, but to be completely honest, my ult doesn't really help much in this situation anyway, the delay between cast and impact on Voice of Light, is longer than the delay between Fizz landing from his E, and then using Q. And Its near impossible to predict exactly where his Q will deposit him AND time it correctly, so you cant aim there either. So while he does have the level advantage, it wouldn't make as big of a difference as you think, even if we were both lvl 6. 

**Also:** when the fish struck me, it put Comet of Legend on cooldown, _(something that only damage is supposed to do)_, and the fish does no damage until the shark erupts. So i don't understand why Comet of Legend was put on cooldown. 

So if someone could assist me, and let me know what I was doing wrong, and how I should be playing the situation, that would be so much appreciated ^^
_(also if someone could explain why Comet of Legend was put on cooldown when the fish hit me, that would be very insightful.)_

Thanks heaps :)

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

replies.body: unless you have zhonyas fizz landing his ult is pretty much a death sentence

Biggest thing to note, _Being at a longer range is actually bad_.

Fizz's new shark actually increases in damage and size at range, so the further you are, if the shark is spot on, the harder it is to dodge, though this isn't optimal for Aurelion, this is just a general thing.

As for this example, you move straight backward from his ult, instead of diagonally or sideways from the skillshot, it is actually a really long skillshot now (the shark you are tagged with is the medium range) so dodge to the sides to make sure the ult doesn't hit you.

When he throws the shark, use your Q, if he gap closes effectively it won't matter (in other words if the enemy fizz knows what he is doing) but a bad fizz (this fizz included) will actually be stunned by The Q, as it will get to popping range before he finished gap closing.

Otherwise your basically dead in lane in most scenarios, and your best chance is a good jungler gank.

If you suspect his ult, You should be able to flash it, that way he misses out on so much DMG, retract your stars, and try and kite him under tower and stun him.

If this wasn't blind- 
Try running Exhaust or Clense.

Exhaust means he does 50% less dmg, and his armor - MR is also reduced.
Cleanse, means even if you get hit by a shark, you should be able to cleanse it and run away.

Thanks for the advice!
Both our flashes were down, so unfortunately that wasn't an option this time. But surely "Flash his ability" cant be the only counterplay?
I would love to just sit under tower, but the first kill he got on me, was when i WAS under tower, and just just flashes in, bursts his combo, and E's away unscathed :/

It was blind pick, so there wasn't much i could do about that, but in ranked i will look at taking those spells! Thats a good idea.
well first thing don't just walk up to fizz when you know he has his ult and then just run away in a straight line.
